content:
is there is any special purpose of having narrow to topic in the topic popover?
Screenshot-from-2020-05-15-13-19-01.png
clicking on the topic do the same job, or am I missing something?
And there's no narrow to stream in the streap popover... If we're fiddling there, wouldn't it make sense to have Mute and Mark all in the same order in both popovers?

yeah...fair point
I am working on the popover UI, will fix the order
I think the purpose in having that there at one would was part of establishing terminology and/or the idea of what the default thing to do with a topic is.
(I'm pretty sure it was added in response to some in-person usability study years ago)

I'm no UX designer, but I do know that it's a moving target. It does seem odd to have the first item in the menu (which I think users sees it as) be the same action as when clicking on it. I think people understand the idea that clicking on the topic "selects" it. Granted, it doesn't establish "narrow" as the label for that action, but is that needed there?
Yeah, my personal opinion is we should remove it; was just giving background context that might not be obvious.
Oh, okay. :slight_smile:
